name: genesis_v2.mkl
title: genesis_v2
summary:
Runs single variant and aggregate test for genetic data.  Implements Single-variant, Burden, SKAT and SKAT-O tests for Continuous or Dichotomous outcomes. All tests account for familiar relatedness through kinship matrixes.


Underlying functions adapted from:
Conomos MP and Thornton T (2016). GENESIS: GENetic EStimation and Inference in Structured samples (GENESIS): Statistical methods for analyzing genetic data from samples with population structure and/or relatedness. R package version 2.3.4. 
	http://bioconductor.org/packages/devel/bioc/html/GENESIS.html
	https://github.com/smgogarten/GENESIS

inputSpec.name: outcome_name
inputSpec.label: Column name of the outcome variable in the phenotype file

inputSpec.name: covariate_list
inputSpec.label: Comma separated list that match column names in the phenotype file. Leave blank for no adjustments

inputSpec.name: snpinfofile
inputSpec.label: Annotation file for filtering variants.  The variant ....

inputSpec.name: outputfilename
inputSpec.label: prefix for output file name, no spaces

inputSpec.name: kinshipmatrix
inputSpec.label: kinship matrix with sample ids as the row and column names.  Matrices save as R data will load faster, but csv is accepted as well

inputSpec.name: test_type
inputSpec.help: Valid tests are one of the collapsing tests SKAT, Burden, SKATO or Single

inputSpec.name: test_stat
inputSpec.help: Valid tests statistic types are: Score, Wald. Firth can be used with Burden test only.

inputSpec.name: pheno_id
inputSpec.help: Column name that contains the sample IDs.  These IDs should match the genotype file IDs and the kinship file IDs.

inputSpec.name: buffer
inputSpec.help: Additional flanking region around aggregation start & stop regions. Often used for adding flanking regions to aggregation files based on transcript start and stop.

inputSpec.name: genefile
inputSpec.help: File contains the start and stop positions for aggregating variants into region-based tests.  File must contain 3 requeired columns labeled 'start', 'stop' and 'CHR'.   start and stop must be numeric.  CHR must be in the form of 'chr#'.

inputSpec.name: snp_filter
inputSpec.help: Filter the annotation file.  Can filter based on the annotation column names using R syntax (e.g. CADD_phred_score > 10 | function %in% ('nonsynonymous','splice','stoploss','stopgain')) , where 'CADD_phred_score' and 'function' are column names in annotation file.

inputSpec.name: gene_filter
inputSpec.help: Filter the aggregation file.  Can filter based on the gene column names using R syntax (e.g. start > 1e6 & stop < 1e7) or (name %in% c('IL2','IL17R'), where 'name', 'start' and 'stop' are column names in aggregation file.

inputSpec.name: min_mac
inputSpec.help: Minimum minor allele count for threshold ( generally used for single variant tests )

inputSpec.name: top_maf
inputSpec.help: Maximim minor allele frequency ( generally used for aggregate tests )
